title: Test Recipe
description: A comforting bowl of pasta with a simple creamy sauce and crispy roasted broccoli.

ingredients.name: Pasta
ingredients.note: About half a standard packet. Any shape works â€” penne, fusilli, spaghetti.

ingredients.name: Garlic
ingredients.note: Or 3 teaspoons of pre-minced garlic from a jar.

ingredients.name: Broccoli
ingredients.note: About 2 cups when cut into pieces.

ingredients.name: Butter
ingredients.note: About the size of two thumb-tips.

ingredients.name: Cream cheese
ingredients.note: From a block or tub. Or substitute Â½ cup heavy cream.

ingredients.name: Olive oil
ingredients.note: For the broccoli. Any cooking oil works.

equipment.name: Large pot
equipment.note: Big enough to hold 3â€“4 litres of water. Your biggest pot.

equipment.name: Baking tray
equipment.note: Also called a sheet pan. Any flat oven-safe tray.

equipment.name: Colander
equipment.note: A bowl with holes for draining. A lid held ajar on the pot works too.

equipment.name: Mug or cup
equipment.note: For scooping out pasta water before draining.

stages.label: Preparation
stages.description: Getting everything chopped, measured, and ready before any heat goes on.

steps.instruction: Peel 3 cloves of garlic and mince them into small pieces. Set aside on a small plate or bowl.
Cut the broccoli into bite-sized florets. You'll need about 2 cups â€” roughly one medium head.
Measure out: 2 tablespoons of butter, Â½ cup of cream cheese (or heavy cream), and your pasta (about 200g).
steps.hint: Having everything pre-measured means you won't need to hunt for things while the stove is on.

stages.label: Cooking
stages.description: Some of these steps run at the same time â€” the app will manage the timing for you.

steps.instruction: Fill a large pot about Â¾ full with water and place it on the stove over high heat. Add a generous pinch of salt.

generous pinch of salt.title: How much salt?
generous pinch of salt.text: About 1 tablespoon, or grab some between your thumb and fingers and toss it in.

steps.actionLabel: Water is at a rolling boil
steps.completionHint: Big, vigorous bubbles breaking the surface â€” not just tiny bubbles on the bottom.

steps.instruction: Pour the pasta into the boiling water and give it a stir.
steps.hint: Stir once or twice during cooking so the pasta doesn't stick together.

steps.instruction: Before draining: scoop out a mugful of the cooking water and set it aside. Then drain the pasta in a colander.
In the same pot (no need to wash it), add the butter and minced garlic over medium heat. Stir gently.
steps.actionLabel: Butter and garlic are in the pot
steps.hint: You're waiting for the garlic to become fragrant and lightly golden. If it starts going dark brown, take the pot off the heat.

steps.instruction: Turn the heat to low. Add the cream cheese (or cream) and a splash of the saved pasta water. Stir until smooth.
steps.completionHint: A few small lumps are fine â€” they'll melt as you stir.

steps.instruction: Add the drained pasta back into the pot with the sauce. Toss to coat every piece. Serve in bowls topped with the roasted broccoli.
Preheat your oven to 200Â°C (400Â°F). Spread the broccoli on a baking tray, drizzle with olive oil, and season with salt and pepper.
steps.completionHint: Spread pieces out â€” don't pile them. Spacing helps them crisp.

steps.instruction: The broccoli roasts in the background while you continue with the pasta. You'll be alerted when it's done.
steps.hint: Once started, the timer appears pinned at the bottom of the screen.

steps.instruction: Remove the broccoli from the oven. It should be lightly charred on the edges and tender when pierced with a fork.
steps.actionLabel: Broccoli is out of the oven
steps.completionHint: A few dark spots are good â€” that's flavour, not burning.
